intro: Eriospermum descendens, commonly known as the descending eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Due to its unique adaptations, it is well-suited for xeriscaping and requires minimal water once established.
